On Fri, 1 Aug 2003, Adam Jack <ajack@...> wrote:

> I'm sorry, but it seems to me that there is little or no use of the
> framework, ant has effectively re-written it.

Adam, I'm very familiar with the code Ant uses and I know its history
quite well.  Trust me, we've not rewritten the framework.

The only thing we've more or less rewritten is the runner.  The reason
for this is simply that the corresponding runner package didn't exit
three years ago (we are talking JUnit 3.1 or even 3.0 here when Thomas
an myself started to work on the Ant integration).  Ant still supports
JUnit 3.0, that's why we can't change the implementation easily.

> It seems (from reading this) that ant leverages the testcase class
> "assert" helper methods & little else.

As Scott points out, the TestListener concept is heavily relied upon
in Ant.

> That said, I have a problem when running them inside Eclipse 'cos
> they (I believe) use paths relative to the project they are in.

More likely the current working directory.

> The Eclipse test collector finds tests in dependent projects,

I have little to no experience with running BuildFileTest subclasses
outside of the scope of Ant's <junit> task, sorry.

> Any thoughts on how I solve this, or if there are one or two bugs I
> ought report?

If you can pin down the problems, you certainly should report them as
bugs, thanks.  8-) Even if you can't provide a patch, it may be worth
a report.

Stefan
